name: Early WWW Efforts in Palestine
description: Birzeit University led perhaps the largest early Palestinian Web Development initiative of the time, compiling resources, raising money, etc. These pages show the prescience of Early webmasters at Birzeit of the rapidly growing potential of the web to connect and amplify Palestinian voices in an unprecedented way.

name: Infomration Technology
description: These pages highlight businesses and organizations which made up the early social infrastructure of computing and networking in Palestine - including software companies, Internet service providers, and Internet cafes

name: Palestinian News Online
description: These pages include newspapers, information sites, and online magazines, based in Palestine as well as by Palestinians in the Diaspora

name: Innovative Uses of the Early Web
description: These pages showcase savvy uses of early HTML capabilties, to stitch together examples of hypermedia as an interactive museum or

name: Documenting and Memorializing under Occupation
description: These pages show independent efforts to document with stories, and data, honoring martyrs while also disseminating first hand reporting of Occupation and Israeli response to Palestinian revolt

name: Palestinian Art and Artists on the Early Web
description: These pages show the Web, and combination of image+text for use by artists to create portfolios, etc

name: The People of Palestine, Online
description: This section includes personal homepages created by Palestinians on services like Angelfire and Geocities, which allowed Internet users to easily build expressive webpages populated by personal information, photos of loved ones, links to , and lots of gifs.
